getParameterByName() and getCookieByName()

Date: 21 Dec 2012
Author: Erik Dubbelboer

When writing some code that should be as small as possible you donâ€™t want to include jQuery, MooTools or any other library. These two functions are the functions that I miss most in this case, and I actually think these should implemented natively by the browsers.

getParameterByName(name) returns the value of the named url parameter.

getCookieByName(name) returns the value of the cookie with the specified name.

These functions work in: IE 6+, Firefox 6+, Chrome 22+, Safari 6+ and Opera 12+.
